description: Join us for a retrofit focused open studio at Conran and Partners, award-winning architecture and interior design studio, showcasing the holistic way we integrate a retained memory into our work.

factsheet.heading: Further information
paragraphs: Join us for "Retaining the Memory," where we delve into the intricacies of working with existing buildings. Discover more about Conran and Partners' approach to the retrofit and re-use of structures over the past 30 years, across varying scales and typologies, from master planning to architecture and interiors, from residential to workplace and hospitality.

Through engaging pin-ups and a talk, attendees will gain insights into the value of retaining the memory of place, giving existing spaces a new life, as well as experiencing first hand our approach to the retrofit of our studio in an existing building.
Join us in celebrating the re-use of existing structures, old and new.

factsheet.heading: Conran and Partners
paragraphs: Conran and Partners is an internationally renowned architecture and interior design practice, founded by Sir Terence Conran.
With studios in London and Hong Kong, Conran and Partnersâ€™ portfolio extends around the world and embraces a rich and varied range of cultures, typologies and scales.

Conran and Partners delivers award-winning buildings and spaces, that endeavour to be progressive and sustainable. This is achieved through a carefully considered and collaborative design process that addresses the needs and desires of the users, as well as the wider environment.

location.address: Conran and Partners, 30a Great Sutton Street, EC1V 0DU

name: Retaining the Memory
